text: WhatsApp , founded in 2009 , was a relatively young company that employed only 50 people and earned merely $ 10 million in revenue in 2013 .It was one of many mobile messaging services that allowed users to contact each other without paying costly text message fees .
label: CompareOrContrast

text: Today its model railway division produces trains for customers in many parts of the World and with the setting up of Bachmann Europe in 1989 , has developed its own markets in Britain and Europe by acquiring well known brand names such as Graham Farish and Liliput .
label: CompareOrContrast

text: In 2014 , seven years after he was appointed CEO of the Danish shipping and oil conglomerate A.P. Møller Maersk ( the Maersk Group ) , Nils Andersen was reexamining the size and role of corporate headquarters in the company he had reshaped as a " premium conglomerate . " But as the business units ( BUs ) and corporate headquarters adjusted to their new roles , new issues surfaced .
label: CompareOrContrast

text: Facebook , the social networking website that allowed users to share information with friends , believed WhatsApp was a logical next step that would help it achieve its mission of " making the world more open and connected ." When Facebook announced the acquisition , it vowed to keep WhatsApp operating independently , letting the founders control the direction of the company and allowing WhatsApp to stay true to its mission .
label: CompareOrContrast
